message.content: This question requires knowledge about how organisms adapt to their environment. If a fish lives in water that is very dark, over time it may adapt by becoming blind. This adaptation allows the fish to utilize its other senses and navigate effectively in the dark water. Option (A) is unrelated to the fish's adaptation to dark water. Option (B) is incorrect because turning invisible is not a biological adaptation that fish are capable of. Option (C) is unrelated to the adaptation to dark water and is based on a false assumption that fish would need to eat more in dark water.

Option (B) is incorrect because turning invisible is not a known adaptation of fish. Option (C) is unrelated to the adaptation of the fish to a dark environment.

Option (A) is incorrect because absorbing helium is not a relevant adaptation to living in dark water. Option (B) is incorrect because turning invisible is not a characteristic of fish.
